title: Ticket #1656: dprintf_dump_stack() code path doesn't work correctly
description:
I stumbled across this output from a unit test ran in our nightlies.

If you notice, the program actually segfaulted or had some other terrible problem, but yet managed to complete(?!?!) in a manner as to be labeled good by our testing infrastructure.

dprint_dump_stack() is invoked in a signal handler called sig_backtrace_handler() which is registered by install_sig_handler_with_mask() in a function called install_backtrace_handler() in file src/condor_util_lib/dprintf_config.c.

sig_backtrace_handler() is supposed to unblock the errant signal and redeliver it to itself as to cause the process to die by it. Why didn't that happen?
